website_summaries.verdict: Only a few shoes can approach the claim to have maximum cushioning, but light enough to be squarely in the sights of those looking for a lightweight trainer. The Altra Torin 2.5 is one such shoe and more. It has very nice arch support, smooth and effortless transitions, and delivers enough ground feedback despite the significant amount of rubber and cushioning.
pros: The Torin 2.5 secures the shoe in the right places and includes a roomy toe box for fantastic wiggle room to provide runners with a very comfortable run, as observed by most reviewers
Several runners mentioned the bang for the buck value of this shoe
The max cushioning does not compromise the stability or responsiveness, according to a handful of reviews
The glossier upper greatly enhances the aesthetic appeal of the Torin 2.5, as noted by a good number of runners
Some runners noticed how smooth the transition was from landing to take-off
Quite a number appreciate the lightness of the run despite the max cushioning
Many of the comments valued the shoe’s versatility as a high-mileage trainer or as an up-tempo option
Moderate to long runs on varied surfaces is where this beast shines, according to several testers
More than a handful of heavy-framed runners welcomed the midsole’s ability to take a pounding without losing the cushioning or responsiveness
Gender specific variations of the Altra Torin 2.5 for better fit, performance, and style
cons: A large part of the midsole is exposed underneath, which lessens the Torin 2.5’s durability
Some needed a break-in period to get their most comfortable runs
It is ½ smaller than standard
The breathability is not as good as before, as noticed by some of those who have tried the earlier version of the Torin
Some runners still find the shape as funny and they often get strange looks from other runners

customer_reviews.title: The SIZES are NOT standardized.
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra shoes BUT every time I order 8.5 they are not the same size!!! If these current shoes are 8.5 I'll eat them. Why is every pair a different size? I've already gone up a half size, now do I order a complete size up? There is NO standardization. I use these shoes as uniform shoes and up till now loved how they fit my feet. But I don't want to order again because I cannot be sure of the sizing.
customer_reviews.author: DKAero

customer_reviews.title: I really like this shoe and have bought a second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I really didn't think I would like this shoe. The wide toe on my extra-narrow foot makes it look a little like a clown shoe. However, after wearing it once, I have to say I love it! It allows my feet to breathe without flopping around. It fits snugly at the heal and sides and has zero lift which is a deal-breaker for me. I feel like I'm walking on a cloud, yet a secure cloud. I'm not a runner, but I have run in this shoe with no problems. I like it so much I ordered as second pair. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Book Addict

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Running Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more perfect. Zero drop; huge spacious roomy toe box so toes can be splayed in natural position; perfect height of instep and arch support for my high arches; superb cushioning and support for my out-of-shape feet and ankles; and they're even pretty! Love the shoe, love the company.
customer_reviews.author: Liza May

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 Brings it Back
customer_reviews.text: After the epic fail that was the Altra Torin 2.0, I'm thrilled that Altra has gone back to what made the original Torin great. Things I particularly like: -Level of footbed cushion -Heel width (2.0 was far to wide) -Durability of materials I look forward to the next 300 running miles in these!
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Stegall

customer_reviews.title: I started out with the Torin 2.0...
customer_reviews.text: I started out with the Torin 2.0, size 7.5. When time came to replace them I bought the Torin 2.5 Coral in 7.5. When the 2.5 first came out a few reviewers stated that the shoe was tighter than the previous version. Granted it was, but I chalked it up to being new shoes versus old stretched out shoes. I just bought these shoes, Torin 2.5 size 7.5 Raspberry, and both shoes are so tight across the top of both my feet I couldn't walk in them let alone run in them. Not sure what happened - they are the correct size, same sole, but there is significantly less material on the raspberry model.
customer_reviews.author: Sprout

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes ever I've ever had. I have had problems all my adult life finding good shoes that don't rub my toes and fit my feet properly. I wear mine all day. I purchased three in pair different colors. Work, play, excercising and to church! What they don't tell you how airy they are and my feet stay dry! When I have gotten water on them both socks and shoes dry quickly....of course depends on the circumstance. My daughter the distance runner told me about Altras, her husband is a believer now, I am and I bought a pair for someone else.
customer_reviews.author: Facelikeaflint

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommened for hallux rigidus
customer_reviews.text: I am a marathoner with ongoing hallux rigidus problems. I had a "clean up" surgery in Dec of 2015 that was pretty unsuccessful as I am still dealing with all of the same issues. I was really looking for a shoe to prolong getting surgery again and these are it. Perfect amount of rigidity and support but with a great deal of cushion and comfort. I am able to do my ling runs with minimal to no pain compared to my old shoes and the wide toe box is amazing. I am absolutely in love these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: fulloveit

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe design ever!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite show! This is my 3rd pair of them. I have had plantar plate tear and my toes started to spread apart as a result. I found my first pair at REI the 2.0 version. I think these are a firmer sole but I like the change. I also bought another pair of the 3.0 version due to color choices and they are softer. I needed tow pairs to alternate days. I teach yoga in them as I cannot go barefoot. They work great for all my workouts. The fit runs small but I expected that. I normal wear an 8 and I wear a 9 in these.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Defects that the old models didn't have
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a lot of the altra torin models over the years and this pair and the last had an odd defect, the heel either the right or left not the same on both shoes would wear the fabric away in a hole that would cause blisters on my foot. Duct tape should not have to be used on a new pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: The Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: Too Tight
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of these in purple and they were wonderful for my arthritic feet. I was hoping that these would be the same but a different color so it did not look like I was wearing the same shoe all the time. Although ordering the same size, unfortunately these were way to tight. Needless to say I was very disappointed and I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Supreme comfort for the toes
customer_reviews.text: I love the wide toe box. I first tried Altra Torins because my orthopedic podiatrist recommended them. I have now bought 3 pairs. These are the only shoes I have tried that don't hurt my toes in one way or another. I had no problem with the zero drop soles. I did not need to get used them. They just felt normal to me right from the beginning. I use orthotics and it was very easy to pull out the insole and insert my prescription orthotics. These shoes are very comfortable in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Miss my Olympus 1.5.....
customer_reviews.text: The toe box is great and these are a light weight shoe. I thought I was buying the high cushion style like the discontinued Olympus 1.5 but these are not. Still a nice sneaker but not if you're looking for the high impact cushioning. Update: After wearing these for a bit I wanted to edit my review. If I had to do it over again, I would pass on this style. If you have problem feet find another style of Altra.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, run small!
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes but I cannot wear them with my orthotics and I cannot walk without them. The shoes seem excelled quality. The show is comfortable if you don't have a custom orthotic insert. The wide toe box is fantastic! I sized up a half size per the recommendation of Altr a (I placed a call to their customer service and they assured me the shoes worked with orthotics). The heel back sits low on the heel. I didn't want to return these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Favorite brand of Athletic Shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I knew these ran small, so I bought a larger size and they fit great. This is my second pair of Altra Torin shoes and I love them. I am not a runner. I have hammer toes and these shoes let my toes lay naturally without cramping or squeezing them. My foot doctor first recommended them and I am glad she did.
customer_reviews.author: DG22RMK

customer_reviews.title: Too wide to prevent foot slippage
customer_reviews.text: I really like the idea of a wider toe box so that my toes can spread out naturally, but these shoes are constructed too widely for me in the lacing area, such that I cannot lace the shoes tightly enough to prevent my feet from slipping forwards in the shoe while I'm jogging. This causes my toes to bang painfully against the front of the shoe. I have normal width feet, and have never had this problem with any B width shoe I've worn in the past.
customer_reviews.author: A mom

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent sizing requiring me to send back
customer_reviews.text: I haven't worn the shoe yet, this is a review of how different this shoe sizes compared to other brands. I tried on a pair of these in a store that only carried up to a size 10. These felt a little too close to my big toe, and the store didn't carry them any bigger than that, so I purchased a 10.5 online. I feel like the shoes fit even tighter than the 10s I tired on in store. I'm determined to find the right fit because the shoe is so appealing otherwise. But buyer beware: Sizing seems to be a recurring issue with these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Almon

customer_reviews.title: Feet no longer hurt
customer_reviews.text: This brand recommended to me by physical therapist, I have no joint space in big toe due to psoriatic arthritis. I no longer have to tape foot or go to PT. I have no foot pain even after putting in 10 hour days 6 days a week on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Kamps

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit disappointed with the fit, I chose the recommended fit which was an 8. I usually wear an 8 however with these I wish I had gone up 1/2 a size. I'll probably hand these off to my sister who usually wears a 7.5.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mccann

customer_reviews.title: I found to be the best in overall comfort
customer_reviews.text: I was quite taken back by the difference in these and my previous Altra Torins. My last two pair, I found to be the best in overall comfort, and with a roomy toe box, but these are more narrow and not nearly as comfortable as the previous ones. I ordered a whole size up than what I wear in everyday shoes, so surprised how tight in width and length, they are. That being said, am keeping and hope they stretch and become more comfortable. We'll see ......
customer_reviews.author: Pat Staub

customer_reviews.title: Great cushioning
customer_reviews.text: I love Altra’s, this is my tenth pair. I bought these again because they have great cushioning and I need a little extra right now after neck surgery. The fit is amazing and they look great as well for a toe box shoe. Recommend going up 1/2 a size
customer_reviews.author: lonematthews

customer_reviews.title: these shoes are much smaller than the ones I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: these shoes are much smaller than the ones I bought last year at a running shop. they are unwearable even thought the size and width are the same. I am disappointed
customer_reviews.author: LUCK

customer_reviews.title: Love My Altra's!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a half size bigger, so they fit great. Not tight at all. Took a 5 mile walk to break in the reinforced uppers, but these are awesome shoes. Will always be an altra person!! Update 2 weeks later: thought i broke in the shoes. Did not! Its weird because one foot feels great, the other shoe feels like its stabbing me right where it flexes. Very dissapointed in the torins. Plus they wear out on the bottom too fast. Did about 40 miles and the bottoms coming off already.
customer_reviews.author: GRACE

customer_reviews.title: I think mine was irregular or even a knock off
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable. More than the pair I ordered from Altra, but they have a new version and I wanted 2.5. But look at the picture. The uppers on both shoes are the same. I have the corals too and they both have the same patterns on the outside of each shoes . The shoes look completely different. I am still keeping them for comfort but i think i am done buying from any but Altra now.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: True to size, unlike other Altras
customer_reviews.text: I really like the fit and feel of these shoes with one exception: I have a pair of Paradigms and have had other Altras before that and they always ran small, so I ordered a half-size up as I always have. Nope. These ones are true to size. Slightly thicker socks and alternate lacing tactics mean that I now have a pair of shoes for really long runs when my feet start to swell a bit. Altras remain my favorites, though I should have paid attention to the size ratings here.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Michaud

customer_reviews.title: So uncomfortable you will try to speed-walk out of them.
customer_reviews.text: This shoe has the most painful heel. It is stiff and without any give. The shoe itself felt crooked too. It give a ton of room to the outer side of the foot but seems to lack room towards the inner side. I'm not sure how it is possible! Also, I don't walk like a duck; these shoes want me to.
customer_reviews.author: SciFi Junkette

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! I have the Lone Peak 3.0 and love them too. The Torins are a bit narrower in the toe but still plenty roomy. They also have more cushion than the LP. I typically wear an 8 but have 8 1/2 in both Torin & Lone Peak. I am a fan of Altra. I have suffered from toe pain while hiking/walking but no more!
customer_reviews.author: K. Millar

customer_reviews.title: Inside wearing out too fast!
customer_reviews.text: inside is wearing out after only a couple months. I only use for my walking a few times a week for an hour or so. Company said to contact amazon 1st to see if they would help me or replace them. I have a pair of the trail shoes, same size that have held up great on the inside, I just wore those so much that the soles wore out (understandably). Amazon can you help me?
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Licon

customer_reviews.title: I love the way these shoes fit and feel
customer_reviews.text: I love the way these shoes fit and feel, they're my go to street running shoe. Unfortunately, they tend to completely fall apart at around 300 miles which is a bit at the lower end of shoes that I've used over the years. Also, when I mean fall apart, I mean that the inner side completely rips out (not a little hole near the toe or anything). That said, I still like these shoes enough to buy them again anyway - I'm on my 3rd pair (both of the first two fell apart at almost exactly 300 miles and in the same way).
customer_reviews.author: Joy E

customer_reviews.title: They are co comfortable. They have so much room in the toes ...
customer_reviews.text: They are co comfortable. They have so much room in the toes so you don't feel squished, but they still fit nicely. I typically wear an 8.5-9, and I ordered an 8.5. My toes go to the end of the shoe without touching the end of the shoe, so they fit perfectly! I think these are my new favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Jones

customer_reviews.title: Love my Altra's
customer_reviews.text: Love my Altra's. I wear Torin's. This is my second pair of the 2.5 but I'm going to return as they just don't have as much cushioning as the 3.0. I recently bought the 3.0 locally and thought I'd get another pair of 2.5 since they're last years style and a little less expensive, but I am on my feet 8+ hours a day on concrete/tile and need that little extra cushion. Other than that, love Altra!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Cats

customer_reviews.title: Altra torain 2.5 for women
customer_reviews.text: This was a good shoe for me and now it looks like this shoe has been discontinued it has good support 2.5 altra torain was a good shoe I do not like a thin shoe this was not thin. this was very supportive. Vendor please restock the shoe
customer_reviews.author: Pam Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a good road running shoe. Was recommended by a friend and after reading the reviews went with them. I was not used to so much cushion at first (I have been using Nike Free for a years) so it took getting used to. I had started running long distance and these were amazing. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: DSblutape

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Shoe That Never Fits
customer_reviews.text: The Torin is a great shoe. Not sure what is going on with Altra? This is my 4th pair of Torins that do not fit regardless of me increasing the size every time I buy them. Too bad. Great shoe - great company.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Love it - but possible defect in my second pair
customer_reviews.text: My second pair of Altra Torins. Unfortunately, this pair had a structural failure which gave me a really bad blister and rendered them useless. The lining inside the heel split and rolled without a large number of miles on them. OUCH. I do not know if it was a defect nor if the company will replace them. Hoping to hear back based on this review.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Henkle

customer_reviews.title: If they end up feeling as good as my first pair of Torin 2
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the Torin 2.5 and I'd expect them to fit the same; however, they feel slightly shorter in length and the height of the toe box somehow feels narrower ... how can that be? I am counting on some fabric stretch after wearing these a few times. My rating is preliminary. If they end up feeling as good as my first pair of Torin 2.5's (which I love), my rating will zoom up to five star.
customer_reviews.author: dil

customer_reviews.title: Wide toes and lots of sponge in the heal. Great for wife's feet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my wife's go to brand for her feet. She will not even consider others. We went through many a trial with many a different brand and these work for her. She had bunionectomies on both feet, and needs a shoe with a wider toe. This provides that and more.
customer_reviews.author: DocHolliday

customer_reviews.title: great cushion and support
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for work--I am on my feet all day in the medical field. So far I am very impressed; great cushion and support, but my foot doesn't feel constricted at all. Love the wide toe box too. The zero drop feels a little different; I can tell my leg muscles are getting more of a workout when I walk--as if I were barefoot, but that's a plus!
customer_reviews.author: A. Kite

customer_reviews.title: Sized small
customer_reviews.text: Love the shoes but sized small. I have two other pairs of Altra which I love. Both size 9. I purposely ordered a size 10 for toe room to walk more aggressively. Shoes very comfortable but fit exactly like size 9. Am returning them but I will try Altra again.
customer_reviews.author: CJ in Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love the room my toes have in the Altra Torin shoes. I liked the 2.0 a little better as the 2.5 has a crease where the foot bends when tiptoeing on the shoe. That may be from the shipping as the shoe came out of the box that way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the black and pink color - its girly
customer_reviews.text: Love the black and pink color - its girly. Laces are a bit short, hard to double knot them. The pairs I have had wear fast but I have to have them for the room in to toes. I also buy mine 2 sizes bigger and they still don't drown me.
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Have another pair that fit fine. This pair was not as wide.
customer_reviews.author: frogger

customer_reviews.title: Great toe box
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy running in Altras. The toe box is roomy enough for toe sock. They are lightweight and comfortable right out of the box. These are listed as a trail shoe but I’ve run in them for a marathon on pavement and felt great! If you wished for more toe room these are the shoes for you!
customer_reviews.author: Drina H.

customer_reviews.title: Totaaly wromg size
customer_reviews.text: I love this shoe as I already have a pair. I need a second pair that I can use outside the gym. These were marked size 10 but must have been a women's 8 instead. I was terribly disappointed. I will shop locally for shoes! The refund was rapid which i appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Nirmal Nam

customer_reviews.title: My toes love this shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe for those with a wide toe base but a narrow heel. It took all the pressure off my toes that I feel in all other athletic shoes. The only issue for me is some slippage in the back of the heel, but that might be because I wear special orthotic inserts instead of the inserts the shoes come with.
customer_reviews.author: K.W.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Just bought these and have the exact pair but in another color but these ones are way small and have to return. Doesn’t make sense how they can be different in size if they are the same style shoe
customer_reviews.author: Christie

customer_reviews.title: Loving that toe box
customer_reviews.text: I almost cried with happiness when I received the shoe. The toe box is wide like I wanted. Popular shoe brands have to boxes which are narrow for me. My 3 end toes curl on wearing popular brands. Not with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great road shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Nice wide toe box. Lots of comfortable cushion in this road shoe. Take some getting used to for the zero drop, but after your muscles adjust, feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Elayna

customer_reviews.title: The Remedy for Overcorrected Bunion Surgery
customer_reviews.text: Because of a bunion surgery side effect where the big toe moves to the right these are the only shoes I can use. They take getting used to because of the spongie feel and look a bit wide but I am just grateful to have found them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Elizabeth Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Wow, finally a comfortable toe box for running/walking.
customer_reviews.text: I love these running shoes. I bought them in 81⁄2 which is a 1⁄2 size larger than my usual size and they fit perfectly. They do take a little adjustment period but my feet feel great. I will buy these exact ones again soon so I always have a pair ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: C. Kudish

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but seem much more snug than other Altra styles
customer_reviews.text: I have several pair of Altra shoes and these seem much more snug than other styles. They have quite a bit of cushion on the sole so they are comfortable that way, but they are tight around the instep, even with the shoelaces loosened.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Life

customer_reviews.title: Great fitting; soles fell off in 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Best fitting shoes I've ever worn. Problem is that the soles starting falling off after only 2 weeks of wear. I'm restricted from exercise at this time so the shoes didn't receive hard wear. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Rice

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Sizing
customer_reviews.text: I love the Altra Trail Runner, this would have been my second pair but it was too small, same size I previously ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Karlsson

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes?
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these shoes! Fit is great with the wide toe box wide enough not to squeeze my toes. I recently broke my little toe and these are the only shoes I can wear for walking. They are cushioned and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Cannon

customer_reviews.title: same shoes & size, completely different fit!
customer_reviews.text: Loved my first pair, sadly eaten by my dog. Just got my second pair of the exact style and size (8)-this one from Amazon. These are AT LEAST a 1/2 size too small/short. Unfortunately, I didn't try them on before they went to the shoe repair guy (have to get a lift split into the R sole). So now I can't return them! My fault...but COME ON...I could understand if they were slightly tighter...but shorter?!!
customer_reviews.author: J Oliphant

customer_reviews.title: Good for walking and my core fitness class
customer_reviews.text: I already owned a pair of this Altra shoes model and liked them, so ordered another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Holmer

customer_reviews.title: Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of the Torin 2.5 trail runner same size as previously purchased. I have been wearing this pair for going on 2 weeks trying to break them in (break in not required on first pair) and they are still too tight and seem to be too short. I normally try on all shoes due to my feet being wide, but normally stick to something that works the first time. Very disappointed :(
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Poor Qulaity control
customer_reviews.text: I expected better from Altra. I really love this shoe, but after 5 weeks, the sole started to come off the bottom of the shoe, with very minimal use. I keep tripping and have to re-glue it, because I can no longer return it!!!! Very disappointed. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jman

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe, but won't last forever
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit great, requiring very little time to break in with the wide toe box. My only complaint, as others had, is that the sole wears out somewhat quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair and I get them 1/2 size larger than regular shoes. I like plenty of room in running shoes! These shoes work great for me. I run 5-10 miles at least 5 times a week in them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes but as will most running shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes but as will most running shoes, make sure you order a full size up from your street shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbiejoe derhak

customer_reviews.title: Tread peels off after 1 month
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and lightweight. My feet don't get hot in these. But after about a month, the tread started peeling off on the bottom. Maybe I just got a defective pair but I can't exchange them for a new pair at this point anymore. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more foot pain!
customer_reviews.text: If you have trouble with your feet like I do, you must try these shoes. I have 2 bone spurs on the inside of my toes and planter fasciitis. I am also on my feet all day. I have no toe pain or foot pain anymore. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: windy wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Love the fit since I have a narrow heel
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit since I have a narrow heel. True to size since it runs narrower and smaller than the Altra Lone Peak 3.0 trail runners.
customer_reviews.author: JENNIE C

customer_reviews.title: I liked the shoes but the size was way too small ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoes but the size was way too small in my case. They were more like size 7.5 instead of 8.5, so I had to return these and order size 9.
customer_reviews.author: seth b

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes ... I am not a runner, but these are very comfortable to walk in all day.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Altra's are awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes!!!! Second pair of these and they are great! No need for insoles at all and my plantar fasciitis hasn't inflamed at all since wearing them!
customer_reviews.author: wnp

customer_reviews.title: attractive sports shoe
customer_reviews.text: For me, these were tight in the instep with very little arch support. They're fine for spinning even with the wider toe, but I didn't find them comfortable for running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super comfortable but not as durable as expected
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes! I've had them about 2 months and run on pavement about 3 times a week and my legs feel great! They are cushy but firm enough to feel supported. The only negative that I have noticed so far is that the bottom of the shoe seems to be showing wear very quickly. I hope they will last for a good amount of mileage!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Shoe is Very comfortable! I ordered a half size bigger and think I could go up another 1/2 size. I typically wear an 8. Rarely and 8.5. I ordered an 8.5 and think I could easily wear a 9. But shoes are very comfortable and light weight. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: These help reduce foot pain from daily walking. They ...
customer_reviews.text: These help reduce foot pain from daily walking. They are not just for runners. If you have sore feet everyday, try these. Well worth the cost. Run a bit small though.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: I've run in these for years, but this new ...
customer_reviews.text: I've run in these for years, but this new model is a bit different. The toe seems to wrinkle and rub on my second toe.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn T

customer_reviews.title: Awesome shoe! I just got new orthotics I need ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoe! I just got new orthotics I need to wear all the time. The toe box is roomy and allows my foot to assume a natural position. My gait is really improved and my knees don't hurt all the time.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: These are great but will go up a half size next time
customer_reviews.text: I walk 5 miles everyday on hard surfaces. These are great but will go up a half size next time.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I have a rather large bunion on my right foot, and regular shoes press against it and after a while make my bunion hurt. I can wear these all day, and NO Pain!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Borsodi

customer_reviews.title: I like the shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes. Finally my toes won't hurt anymore. I plan to buy a second pair with different color.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Hulten

customer_reviews.title: They're the best
customer_reviews.text: I love them! Wish I could wear them all day every day! They're worth every penny! My feet love them.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ward

customer_reviews.title: comfortable toe box
customer_reviews.text: Fit to size with wide, comfortable toe box. Welll padded sole that is missing from many running shoes I've bought. Very happy with this shoe. Worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: FoxRun

customer_reviews.title: Order whole size larger!
customer_reviews.text: Nice running shoe, go up a whole size. Runs very small, already ordered another! Can't wait! I'm typically an 8 1/2, hoping a 9 1/2 will work!!
customer_reviews.author: desgal

customer_reviews.title: These are my favorite running shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite running shoes! I have continue to get the same style becuase they work so well with my feet issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly S.

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I had read they were running 1/2 size small, so I order to compensate. I'm glad I did. Across the top of the foot is a little tight with my orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: Had these same shoes, ordered the same size. Too small and felt like seconds. Returned for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marie B.

customer_reviews.title: Roasts your feet
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have sent them back. The fabric doesn't breathe at all. They are so hot, I can't wear them very long.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy Vick

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: most comfortable shoes I have worn in three years, a good shoe if you have neuropathy.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Nelson

customer_reviews.title: These have a nice large toe box which is helpful if you wear ...
customer_reviews.text: These have a nice large toe box which is helpful if you wear orthotics. Love these shoes, its my third pair to try.
customer_reviews.author: jsclady

customer_reviews.title: Love My Altra Torins
customer_reviews.text: I love the Altra Torin 2.5 running shoes. I have been wearing these shoes for 5 years now. I ordered the 7 but had to send them back they where to small. I went up a half size and they fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them. Thank god they fit
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Thank god they fit. I've tried on same shoes in store in same sizes and they not fit. Have been told quality control isn't great for that brand.
customer_reviews.author: kasey80

customer_reviews.title: Ordinarily I like this shoe as I have a wide forefoot and ...
customer_reviews.text: The 9.5 was tighter and shorter than the 9 that I have of this style in another color. Ordinarily I like this shoe as I have a wide forefoot and narrow ankle. I usually wear between an 8.5 and a 9.
customer_reviews.author: Falls

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes but too small and wear too fast.
customer_reviews.author: Angelmom05

customer_reviews.title: Raspberry color size too small
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Raspberry pair and they are to small. I have another style of Altra shoes and they fit well. Not these...recommend going up at least a half size. Like the color and feel, but my toes are scrunched up in the toe box.
customer_reviews.author: D. Guill

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes! Love all the room for my toes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes! Love all the room for my toes. I normally wear a 9 wide but after reading other reviews about how they run small I got a 9 and 1/2 and they fit great .
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Way too big- different from store
customer_reviews.text: These shoes were way too big. I tried a women’s 7 on in the exact same style st a running store and they fit fine. I ordered them on here to save money. I don’t know what’s going on with this pair. I wouldn’t recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and ordered a half size bigger than my usual size and they fit perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie R. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got them for the wife. She loves the roominess of the toe area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best ever running shoes. I only walk but they work wonderfully for fast walking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! These are last season’s model and are replacing the same pair. They are only good for six months or so- the cushion does not hold up- but that’s appropriate for a running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is my 3rd pair of Altra Women's Torin 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd pair of Altra Women's Torin 2.5. I'm returning this pair because the fit is off. The shoes feel tight and short at the toe unlike my previous 2 pairs. I hope the next pair fits as usual.
customer_reviews.author: MARY JEFFERSON

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my wife, she loves them! True to size, help her knees while she runs.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes!! Feet are not in pain when running or walking!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul / Angel Centofanti

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. I got them because of an issue with my big toe and these shoes were initially kinda tight but the shoe themselves were extremely comfortable. I wear them to work where I average 8 to 10 thousand step a day and they are very supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Fells

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed my toes were still hitting the top of the shoe and i went up a whole size. So I returned them and will stick with my New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: jf

product_meta.title: ALTRA Women's Torin 2.5 Trail Runner
product_meta.description: The torin 2.5 maintains the lightweight, cushioned and form-improving benefits of its predecessor with a new look and extra flexibility. The footshape toe box allows your toes to spread out naturally for more stability and speed. The high level of cusioning includes our responsive a-bound compound that returns energy into each step and is weight-balanced from front to back to encourage low-impact landing. Footpod outsole technology maps the bones and tendons of your foot for a free, natural flex. Let your foot do its thing and run better with the torin 2.5.
feature_bullets: Dual-layer EVA midsole with A-Bound top layer & Innerflex
Foot-Shaped Toe Box accommodates toe splay
